resources.string: A button that uses the full width of the screen looks like this:
A disabled button looks like this (any size):
This is an example app to demonstrate the design of a Privacy Friendly App. Further explanations can be found in the Privacy Friendly App Guide.

There are multiple ways to display basic buttons. Button 1 is the basic button. If you wish to separate a button visually, use button 2. The buttons 3–5 are examples for highlighted buttons. Depending on the app other colors are possible.
Use the button in the lower left corner to call the Welcome Dialog.
This is the default main menu for game apps. The viewpager above should be used to switch between game modes.
The Privacy Friendly App 2048 is a privacy friendly version of the well-known original game 2048. It has the same funktions without using data from the user.
How can I change the color spectre of the game?
In the chapter configurations is an option to change between two color spectre for the game.
The goal of this game to get the number 2048. With combining numbers with the same value you can reach higher and higher numbers. You can find an extensive explanaition under the topic tutorial.
Is it possible to undo steps?
The app gives you the option to undo your last step in the game. You have to click on the button with the arrow against clockwise direction.
There are a few strategies to win this game. On YouTube you can find a lot of videos which are covering this topic.

This app was part of a master workshop at the Karlsruhe Institute of Technology. With the help of the senior researcher SECUSO we wrote and designed this privacy friendly alternative to the original game.
What makes the app privacy friendly?
This privacy friendly app does not require any permission. It further does not include any tracking mechanisms or advertisement.
This app does not require any permission.
This application belongs to the group of Privacy Friendly Apps developed by Technische Universit√§t Darmstadt. Sourcecode licensed under GPLv3. Images copyright TU Darmstadt and Google Inc.
More information can be found on:
This App serves as a guideline to see the basic design of Privacy Friendly Apps. Here introduce your app in one or two sentences.
Introduce key elements of your app. Do not introduce too many details.
The sourcecode of this app is available at GitHub. For further explanations have a look at the Privacy Friendly App Guide.
This App serves as a guideline to see the basic design of Privacy Friendly Apps. Here introduce your app in one or two sentences.
Introduce key elements of your app. Do not introduce too many details.
The sourcecode of this app is available at GitHub. For further explanations have a look at the Privacy Friendly App Guide.
You won. Would you like to continue?
You lost. Would you like to start a new game?
In the following slides you will learn how to play the Game 2048.
Learn how to move the numbers!
To move all the numbers in the possible position in one direction, you have to swipe your finger in the same way.
To get the next higher power of 2 you have to combine numbers with the same value. The goal is to reach 2048 and higher.
